items.sentence: Let\'s not forget that Tom is only thirteen years old.
Let\'s park the car here and walk the rest of the way.
Let\'s try to settle our differences once and for all.
Many inmates on death row say they don\'t want to die.
I\'m not sure yet, but I think I\'ll become a teacher.
More than 40 percent of the students go to university.
My father will be back at the beginning of next month.
When you\'re in a hurry, it\'s easy to make a mistake.
Don\'t make any noise or you\'ll scare the birds away.
Tom does a pretty good job of forecasting the weather.
Tom promised Mary that he would never see Alice again.
Tom pulled a bottle of bourbon out of his desk drawer.
Tom put a cup of coffee on the table in front of Mary.
Tom put off his wedding because of a traffic accident.
Tom quietly opened the door and tiptoed into the room.
I convinced Tom that he should go to Boston with Mary.
If you need my advice, I\'d be glad to give it to you.
Tom never seems to get upset no matter what Mary does.
Tom read a magazine while waiting for Mary to show up.
Tom solved the puzzle after Mary gave him a few hints.
